xdsl_modem_dhcp_description: The role of a Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server is to assign an IP address and subnet mask for a specified time (via DHCP leases) to a connected item. A DHCP can also configure other parameters such as the default gateway address or DNS servers.
xdsl_modem_dhcp_gateway_tooltip: IP address of the device to which your data will be sent before connecting to the internet (the modemâ€™s LAN IP address is the default)
xdsl_modem_dhcp_primary_dns_tooltip: IP address of the name server that will be used by devices receiving a DHCP server address
xdsl_modem_dhcp_secondary_dns_tooltip: IP address of a secondary name server that will be contacted if the first one does not respond
xdsl_modem_dhcp_playa_dhcp_tooltip: Start and end address for the IP address range that the DCHP servers will provide to the local network
xdsl_modem_dhcp_allocation_time_tooltip: Duration that the device retains IP address before expiry (automatic renewal)
xdsl_modem_dhcp_submit_error: Oops! DHCP could not be updated.
xdsl_modem_dhcp_error: Oops! DHCP information could not be retrieved.
xdsl_modem_dhcp_modal_desc: The IP address {{ ipUsed }} is an old OVHcloud DNS server.
xdsl_modem_dhcp_modal_desc_next: Valid OVHcloud DNS servers are {{ ipsToUse }}.
